intro: Centaurium muehlenbergii f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered centaury, is a rare and delicate herbaceous plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
